name: concurrently

at the same time: Her two dramas are being shown concurrently by rival television stations. She will learn today whether her two life sentences will run concurrently or consecutively. See
concurrent
More examplesFewer examplesMr. Hackett will serve his state and federal sentences concurrently.The internship runs concurrently with class work.It is unlikely that the network will schedule all of those shows concurrently.
